project.title: Ultimate MySQL Wrapper Class for PHP 5.x

docblock.description: Ultimate MySQL Wrapper Class for PHP 5.x
docblock.long-description:
Contributions from Frank P. Walentynowicz Larry Wakeman Nicola Abbiuso Douglas Gintz Emre Erkan Vincent van Daal Xander Groesbeek (SQLValue:int quoting; QueryArray tweak) Ger Hobbelt

  • Establish MySQL server connections easily
  • Execute SQL queries
  • Retrieve query results into objects or arrays
  • Retrieve the last inserted ID
  • Manage transactions (transaction processing)
  • Retrieve the list tables of a database
  • Retrieve the list fields of a table (or field comments)
  • Retrieve the length or data type of a field
  • Measure the time a query takes to execute
  • Display query results in an HTML table
  • Easy formatting for SQL parameters and values
  • Generate SQL Selects, Inserts, Updates, and Deletes
  • Error handling with error numbers and text
  • And much more!

Feb 02, 2007 - Written by Jeff Williams (Initial Release) Feb 11, 2007 - Contributions from Frank P. Walentynowicz Feb 21, 2007 - Contribution from Larry Wakeman Feb 21, 2007 - Bug Fixes and PHPDoc Mar 09, 2007 - Contribution from Nicola Abbiuso Mar 22, 2007 - Added array types to RecordsArray and RowArray Jul 01, 2007 - Class name change, constructor values, static methods, fixe Jul 16, 2007 - Bug fix, removed test, major improvements in error handling Aug 11, 2007 - Added InsertRow() and UpdateRows() methods Aug 19, 2007 - Added BuildSQL static functions, DeleteRows(), SelectRows(), IsConnected(), and ability to throw Exceptions on errors Sep 07, 2007 - Enhancements to SQL SELECT (column aliases, sorting, limits) Sep 09, 2007 - Updated SelectRows(), UpdateRows() and added SelectTable(), TruncateTable() and SQLVALUE constants for SQLValue() Oct 23, 2007 - Added QueryArray(), QuerySingleRow(), QuerySingleRowArray(), QuerySingleValue(), HasRecords(), AutoInsertUpdate() Oct 28, 2007 - Small bug fixes Nov 28, 2007 - Contribution from Douglas Gintz Jul 06, 2009 - GetXML() and GetJSON() contribution from Emre Erkan and ability to use a blank password if needed

Usage:

include("mysql.class.php");

$db = new MySQL();
$db = new MySQL(true, "database");
$db = new MySQL(true, "database", "localhost", "username", "password");

tag.name: var

docblock.description: Provide minimal or extended error information
docblock.long-description: Determines if the code is running in a development or production environment: error diagnostics information is far more elaborate in a development environment setting to aid problem analysis and resolution.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Set to false to enable production environment behaviour (reduced info available for errors)

docblock.description: Constructor: Opens the connection to the database

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Auto-connect when object is created

tag.name: param

tag.name: param

tag.name: param

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Password

tag.description: (Optional) Character set

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Character set collation

docblock.description: Destructor: Closes the connection to the database
UPSERT a row
docblock.long-description: Automatically does an INSERT or UPDATE depending on whether a record already exists in a table.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description:
An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.).
This parameter may alternatively be a string, in which case it is used verbatim for the WHERE clause of the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Test if the internal pointer is at the start of the record set
docblock.long-description: Returns true if the internal pointer is at the beginning of the record set produced by the last query.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if at the first row or FALSE if not

docblock.description: Builds a comma delimited list of columns for use with a SQL query
docblock.long-description: This method can be used to construct a SELECT, FROM or SORT BY section of an SQL query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Either an array containing the column names or a string. The latter is used when, for example, constructing 'advanced' queries with SUM(*) or other expressions in the SELECT fieldset section.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) TRUE to add quotes

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) TRUE to show column alias

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) TRUE when the field list is meant for an ORDER BY clause; fields may be prefixed by a plus(+) or minus(-) to indicate sort order. Default is ASCending for each field.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the constructed SQL column list on success or NULL on failure

docblock.description: Builds a SQL DELETE statement

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description:
(Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.). If not specified then all values in the table are deleted.
This parameter may alternatively be a string, in which case it is used verbatim for the WHERE clause of the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the SQL DELETE statement

docblock.description: Builds a SQL INSERT statement

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a SQL INSERT statement

docblock.description: Builds a simple SQL SELECT statement

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The column or list of columns to select

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Column or list of columns to sort by. Column names may be prefixed by a plus(+) or minus(-) to indicate sort order. Default is ASCending for each column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The limit of rows to return

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a SQL SELECT statement

tag.name: note
tag.description: Any of the parameters $whereArray, $columns, $sortColumns or $limit may alternatively be a string, in which case these are used verbatim in the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

docblock.description: Builds a SQL UPDATE statement

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description:
(Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.). If not specified then all values in the table are updated.
This parameter may alternatively be a string, in which case it is used verbatim for the WHERE clause of the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a SQL UPDATE statement

docblock.description: Construct a value string suitable for incorporation anywhere in a SQL query.
docblock.long-description: This methos invokes self::SQLValue() under the hood.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to be checked and processed. Usually this would be a string, but any other type which can be cast to a string is fine as well.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string containing the SQL query ready value.

docblock.description: Builds a SQL WHERE clause from an array.
docblock.long-description: If a key is specified, the key is used at the field name and the value as a comparison. If a key is not used, the value is used as the clause.

tag.name: param
tag.description:
An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.).
This parameter may alternatively be a string, in which case it is returned verbatim. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed and this method is invoked internally.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string containing the SQL WHERE clause

docblock.description: Close current MySQL connection

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Delete selected rows.
docblock.long-description: Deletes rows in a table based on a WHERE filter (can be just one or many rows based on the filter).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description:
(Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.). If not specified then all values in the table are deleted.
This parameter may alternatively be a string, in which case it is used verbatim for the WHERE clause of the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Returns true if the internal pointer is at the end of the records

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if at the last row or FALSE if not

docblock.description: Return the last MySQL error as text

tag.name: note
tag.description: The returned error description string is appended with the error number itself as ' (#error_number)'.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Error text from last known error

docblock.description: Return the last MySQL error as a number

tag.name: return
tag.description: Error number from last known error

docblock.description: Convert any value of any datatype into boolean (true or false)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to analyze for TRUE or FALSE

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE or FALSE

docblock.description: Return the comments for fields in a table

tag.name: param
tag.description: Table name

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array that contains the column comments or FALSE on error.

docblock.description: Get the number of columns

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) If a table name is not specified, the column count is returned from the last query

tag.name: return
tag.description: The total count of columns or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Return the data type for a specified column

tag.name: param
tag.description: Column name or number (first column is 0)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) If a table name is not specified, the last returned records are used

tag.name: return
tag.description: The MySQL data (field) type. If the column does not exist or no records exist, return FALSE.

docblock.description: Return the position of a column

tag.name: param
tag.description: Column name

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) If a table name is not specified, the last returned records are used.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Column ID or FALSE on error.

docblock.description: Return the field length

tag.name: param
tag.description: Column name

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) If a table name is not specified, the last returned records are used.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Field length or FALSE on error.

docblock.description: Return the field name for a specified column number

tag.name: param
tag.description: Column position (0 is the first column)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) If a table name is not specified, the last returned records are used.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The field name for a specified column number. If the given column index number is invalid (does not exist) or no records exist, return FALSE.

docblock.description: Return the field names in a table or query as an array

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) If a table name is not specified, the last returned records are used

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array that contains the column names or FALSE on error.

docblock.description: Return the last query as a HTML table

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) TRUE if you want to show the row count, FALSE if you do not want to show the count

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) table tag attributes, e.g. styling

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) header row tag attributes

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) cell tag attributes

tag.name: return
tag.description: HTML containing a table with all records listed or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Return the last query as a JSON document

tag.name: return
tag.description: JSON containing all records listed

docblock.description: Return the last autonumber ID field from a previous INSERT query

tag.name: return
tag.description: ID number from previous INSERT query

docblock.description: Return the last SQL statement executed

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current SQL query string

docblock.description: Get all table names from the database

tag.name: param
tag.description: [Optional] Comma separated list of acceptable table names: no other table will be listed in the results. Alternatively, when no filter is specified, all tables are listed. This is the default behaviour of this method.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array that contains the table names. If the database does not contain any tables, the returned value is FALSE.

docblock.description: Return the last query as an XML Document

tag.name: return
tag.description: XML containing all records listed

docblock.description: Dump the entire database as an SQL script
docblock.long-description: Produces a SQL script representing the dump of the entire database (when no (optional, comma-separated set of) tables has been specified as a method argument) or just the specified (comma separated set of) tables. You may choose to have either the database/table structure or the records dumped. Or both, for a full-fledged database/table dump which can serve as a db/table backup/restore script later on.

tag.name: param
tag.description: [Optional] Comma separated list of tables. When none are specified, the entire database is assumed (this is the default).

tag.name: param
tag.description: [Optional] Include SQL comments in the generated script (default: TRUE).

tag.name: param
tag.description: [Optional] Whether to include the table structure creation (and tear-down) SQL statements in the generated script (default: TRUE).

tag.name: param
tag.description: [Optional] Whether to include the table rows (data) in the generated script (default: TRUE).

tag.name: param
tag.description: [Optional] Whether to include the apropriate DROP TABLE and/or TRUNCATE TABLE statements in the generated script (default: TRUE).

tag.name: param
tag.description: [Optional] Whether to include the apropriate ALTER DATABASE statement in the generated script to set the default database charset and collation (default: TRUE).

tag.name: return
tag.description: the generated SQL script, boolean FALSE when a query error occurred.

docblock.description: Determines if a query contains any rows

tag.name: param
tag.description: [Optional] If specified, the query is first executed Otherwise, the last query is used for comparison

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if records exist, FALSE if not or query error

docblock.description: Inserts a row into a table in the connected database

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns last insert ID on success or FALSE on failure

docblock.description: Determines if a valid connection to the database exists

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE idf connectect or FALSE if not connected

docblock.description: Determines if a value of any data type is a date PHP can convert

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE if value is date or FALSE if not date

docblock.description: Stop executing (die/exit) and show last MySQL error message

tag.name: param
tag.description: The message to display on exit

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Whether the message should be shown as-is (FALSE) or followed by the last error message/description (TRUE) (Default: TRUE)

docblock.description: Get last error message as HTML string
docblock.long-description: Return the error message ready for throwing back out to the client side while dying, a.k.a. Kill() without the death nor the echo'ing.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The message to display on exit

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Whether the message should be shown as-is (FALSE) or followed by the last error message/description (TRUE) (Default: TRUE)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Return the error message as a HTML string; when the $this->InDevelopmentEnvironment configuration member has been set, the offending query is included for enhanced diagnostics.

docblock.description: Seeks to the beginning of the records

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Seeks to the end of the records

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Connect to specified MySQL server

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Database name

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Host address

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) User name

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Password

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Character set

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Character set collation

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Persistant connection

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Executes the given SQL query and returns the records

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query string should not end with a semicolon

tag.name: return
tag.description: PHP 'mysql result' resource object containing the records on SELECT, SHOW, DESCRIBE or EXPLAIN queries and returns; TRUE or FALSE for all others i.e. UPDATE, DELETE, DROP AND FALSE on all errors (setting the local Error message)

docblock.description: Executes the given SQL query and returns a multi-dimensional array

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query string should not end with a semicolon

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The type of array Values can be: MYSQL_ASSOC, MYSQL_NUM, MYSQL_BOTH

tag.name: return
tag.description: A multi-dimensional array containing all the data returned from the query or FALSE on all errors

docblock.description: Executes the given SQL query
docblock.long-description: Executes the given SQL query and returns an array of objects, where each record is an object with the columns serving as object member variables.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query string should not end with a semicolon

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of record objects containing all the data returned from the query or FALSE on all errors

docblock.description: Returns a multidimensional array of rows from a table based on a WHERE filter

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The column or list of columns to select

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Column or list of columns to sort by. Column names may be prefixed by a plus(+) or minus(-) to indicate sort order. Default is ASCending for each column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The limit of rows to return

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The type of array Values can be: MYSQL_ASSOC, MYSQL_NUM, MYSQL_BOTH

tag.name: return
tag.description: A multi-dimensional array containing all the data returned from the query or FALSE on all errors

tag.name: note
tag.description: Any of the parameters $whereArray, $columns, $sortColumns or $limit may alternatively be a string, in which case these are used verbatim in the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

docblock.description: Returns an array of row (= record) objects from a table based on a WHERE filter

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The column or list of columns to select

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Column or list of columns to sort by. Column names may be prefixed by a plus(+) or minus(-) to indicate sort order. Default is ASCending for each column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The limit of rows to return

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of record objects containing all the data returned from the query or FALSE on all errors

tag.name: note
tag.description: Any of the parameters $whereArray, $columns, $sortColumns or $limit may alternatively be a string, in which case these are used verbatim in the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

docblock.description: Executes the given SQL query and returns only one (the first) row

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query string should not end with a semicolon

tag.name: return
tag.description: PHP resource object containing the first row or FALSE if no row is returned from the query

docblock.description: Returns a single (first) row from a table based on a WHERE filter

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The column or list of columns to select

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Column or list of columns to sort by. Column names may be prefixed by a plus(+) or minus(-) to indicate sort order. Default is ASCending for each column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The limit of rows to return

tag.name: return
tag.description: PHP resource object containing the first row or FALSE if no row is returned from the query

tag.name: note
tag.description: Any of the parameters $whereArray, $columns, $sortColumns or $limit may alternatively be a string, in which case these are used verbatim in the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

docblock.description: Executes the given SQL query and returns the first row as an array

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query string should not end with a semicolon

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The type of array Values can be: MYSQL_ASSOC, MYSQL_NUM, MYSQL_BOTH

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array containing the first row or FALSE if no row is returned from the query

docblock.description: Returns a single (first) row as an array from a table based on a WHERE filter

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The column or list of columns to select

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Column or list of columns to sort by. Column names may be prefixed by a plus(+) or minus(-) to indicate sort order. Default is ASCending for each column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The limit of rows to return

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The type of array Values can be: MYSQL_ASSOC, MYSQL_NUM, MYSQL_BOTH

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array containing the first row or FALSE if no row is returned from the query

tag.name: note
tag.description: Any of the parameters $whereArray, $columns, $sortColumns or $limit may alternatively be a string, in which case these are used verbatim in the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

docblock.description: Executes a query and returns a single value.
docblock.long-description: If more than one row is returned, only the first value in the first column is returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query string should not end with a semicolon

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value returned or FALSE if no value

docblock.description: Returns a single value from from the first row SELECTed from a table based on a WHERE filter.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The column or list of columns to select

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Column or list of columns to sort by. Column names may be prefixed by a plus(+) or minus(-) to indicate sort order. Default is ASCending for each column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The limit of rows to return

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value returned or FALSE if no value

tag.name: note
tag.description: Any of the parameters $whereArray, $columns, $sortColumns or $limit may alternatively be a string, in which case these are used verbatim in the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

docblock.description: Executes the given SQL query, measures it, and saves the total duration in microseconds

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query string should not end with a semicolon

tag.name: return
tag.description: PHP 'mysql result' resource object containing the records on SELECT, SHOW, DESCRIBE or EXPLAIN queries and returns TRUE or FALSE for all others i.e. UPDATE, DELETE, DROP

docblock.description: Returns the records from the last query

tag.name: return
tag.description: PHP 'mysql result' resource object containing the records for the last query executed

docblock.description: Returns all records from the last query as array of arrays
docblock.long-description: Returns all records from the last query and returns the contents as an array of records where each record is presented as an array of columns (fields).

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The type of array representing one record Values can be: MYSQL_ASSOC, MYSQL_NUM, MYSQL_BOTH

tag.name: return
tag.description: Records in array form or FALSE on error. May return an EMPTY array when no records are available.

docblock.description: Returns all records from the last query as array of objects
docblock.long-description: Returns all records from the last query and returns the contents as an array of record objects (where each record is an object with each column as an attribute (data member variable)).

tag.name: return
tag.description: Records in object form or FALSE on error. May return an EMPTY array when no records are available.

docblock.description: Frees memory used by the query results and returns the function result.

tag.name: warning
tag.description: It is an (non-fatal) error to Release() a query result more than once.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) the result originally returned by any previous SQL query.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure

docblock.description: Clears the internal variables from any error information
Reads the current row and returns contents as a PHP object or returns false on error

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Use to specify a row

tag.name: return
tag.description: PHP object or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Reads the current row and returns contents as an array or returns false on error

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Use to specify a row

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The type of array Values can be: MYSQL_ASSOC, MYSQL_NUM, MYSQL_BOTH

tag.name: return
tag.description: Array that corresponds to fetched row or FALSE if no rows

docblock.description: Returns the last query row count

tag.name: return
tag.description: Row count or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Sets the internal database pointer to the specified row number and returns the result

tag.name: param
tag.description: Row number

tag.name: return
tag.description: Fetched row as PHP object on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Returns the current cursor row location

tag.name: return
tag.description: Current row number

docblock.description: Selects a different database and character set

tag.name: param
tag.description: Database name

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Character set (i.e. utf8)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Creates a new database and sets up the root access for the database.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Database name

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Character set (i.e. utf8)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Character set collation (i.e. utf8_unicode_ci)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Database admin user name

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Database admin password

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Gets rows in a table based on a WHERE filter

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The column or list of columns to select

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) Column or list of columns to sort by. Column names may be prefixed by a plus(+) or minus(-) to indicate sort order. Default is ASCending for each column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The limit of rows to return

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns records on success or FALSE on error

tag.name: note
tag.description: Any of the parameters $whereArray, $columns, $sortColumns or $limit may alternatively be a string, in which case these are used verbatim in the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

docblock.description: Retrieves all rows in a specified table

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an array of records (each an object where the columns are individual object member variables) on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Sets the local variables with the first error information

tag.name: param
tag.description: The error description

tag.name: param
tag.description: The error number

docblock.description: Converts a boolean into a formatted TRUE or FALSE value of choice

tag.name: param
tag.description: value to analyze for TRUE or FALSE

tag.name: param
tag.description: value to use if TRUE

tag.name: param
tag.description: value to use if FALSE

tag.name: param
tag.description: Use SQLVALUE constants or the strings: string, text, varchar, char, boolean, bool, Y-N, T-F, bit, date, datetime, time, integer, int, number, double, float

tag.name: return
tag.description: SQL formatted value of the specified data type on success or FALSE on error

tag.name: example
tag.description: echo MySQL::SQLBooleanValue(false, "1", "0", MySQL::SQLVALUE_NUMBER);

tag.name: example
tag.description: echo MySQL::SQLBooleanValue($test, "Jan 1, 2007 ", "2007/06/01", MySQL::SQLVALUE_DATE);

tag.name: example
tag.description: echo MySQL::SQLBooleanValue("ON", "Ya", "Nope");

tag.name: example
tag.description: echo MySQL::SQLBooleanValue(1, '+', '-');

docblock.description: Returns string suitable for inclusion in a SQL query, i.e.

tag.name: return
tag.description: SQL formatted value

docblock.description: Returns MySQL string as normal string

tag.name: warning
tag.description: Do NOT use on columns returned by a database query: such data has already been adequately processed by MySQL itself. The only probable place where the SQLUnfix() method MAY be useful is when DIRECTLY accessing strings produced by the SQLValue() method.

docblock.description: Formats any value into a string suitable for SQL statements

tag.name: note
tag.description: Also supports data types returned from the gettype function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Any value of any type to be formatted to SQL

tag.name: param
tag.description: Use SQLVALUE constants or the strings: 'string', 'text', 'varchar', 'char', 'boolean', 'bool', 'Y-N', 'T-F', 'bit', 'date', 'datetime', 'time', 'integer', 'int', 'number', 'double', 'float'

tag.name: return
tag.description: The properly quoted and escaped/filtered value as a string which can be safely included in a generated SQL query.

docblock.description: Returns last measured duration (time between TimerStart and TimerStop)

tag.name: param
tag.description: (Optional) The number of decimal places to show

tag.name: return
tag.description: Microseconds elapsed

docblock.description: Starts time measurement (in microseconds)
Stops time measurement (in microseconds)
Starts a transaction

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Ends a transaction and commits the queries

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Rolls the transaction back

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure

docblock.description: Truncates a table removing all data

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Updates rows in a table based on a WHERE filter (can be just one or many rows based on the filter)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.)

tag.name: param
tag.description:
(Optional) An associative array containing the column names as keys and values as data. The values must be SQL ready (i.e. quotes around strings, formatted dates, etc.). If not specified then all values in the table are updated.
This parameter may alternatively be a string, in which case it is used verbatim for the WHERE clause of the query. This is useful when advanced queries are constructed.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on error

docblock.description: Return a few database statistics in an array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an array of statistics values on success or FALSE on error.
